Package gov.sandia.gmp.util.nio

Class NioUtils

java.lang.Object
gov.sandia.gmp.util.nio.NioUtils
public class NioUtils extends Object
Contains static methods used for reading/writing data from/to NIO channels using a ByteBuffer. These methods assume that the buffer may be left in a partially-utilized state to minimize expensive underlying system calls when writing data. Read operations always reset the buffer to position 0 prior to reading any data.
Author:
Benjamin Lawry (bjlawry@sandia.gov) created on 07/20/2022

  • Method Details

    • flushBufferToChannel

      public static int flushBufferToChannel(WritableByteChannel dest, ByteBuffer buf) throws IOException
      Writes all bytes left in the specified buffer to the channel and resets the buffer. The channel is left open after this call.
      Parameters:
      dest -
      buf -
      Returns:
      number of bytes written to the channel
      Throws:
      IOException

    • readDoubles

      public static int readDoubles(ReadableByteChannel src, ByteBuffer buf, double[] vals, int idx, int len) throws IOException
      Reads up to len doubles into the specified vals[], starting at index idx.
      Parameters:
      src - data source to read from
      buf - buffer to use for the read operation
      vals - arrays to store read doubles into
      idx - starting index for double storage
      len - maximum number of doubles to read
      Returns:
      the number of doubles actually read
      Throws:
      IOException

    • writeDoubles

      public static int writeDoubles(WritableByteChannel dest, ByteBuffer buf, double... vals) throws IOException
      Writes the specified double values to the specified ByteBuffer, then to the destination channel whenever the buffer fills to capacity. Some bytes may be written to the buffer but not the channel, so the buffer must be externally flushed to the channel after this call is made. The channel is left open after this call.
      Parameters:
      buf -
      dest -
      Returns:
      number of bytes written to the channel
      Throws:
      IOException

    • writeDoubles

      public static int writeDoubles(WritableByteChannel dest, ByteBuffer buf, double[] vals, int off, int len) throws IOException
      Throws:
      IOException

    • writeDoublesFully

      public static int writeDoublesFully(WritableByteChannel dest, ByteBuffer buf, double[] vals, int off, int len) throws IOException
      Throws:
      IOException

    • writeDoubles

      public static int writeDoubles(WritableByteChannel dest, ByteBuffer buf, ArrayListDouble ald) throws IOException
      Writes the specified double values to the specified ByteBuffer, then to the destination channel whenever the buffer fills to capacity. Some bytes may be written to the buffer but not the channel, so the buffer must be externally flushed to the channel after this call is made. The channel is left open after this call.
      Parameters:
      buf -
      dest -
      Returns:
      the number of bytes actually written to the specified channel
      Throws:
      IOException

    • writeDoublesFully

      public static void writeDoublesFully(WritableByteChannel dest, ByteBuffer buf, ArrayListDouble vals) throws IOException
      Same effect as making a call to writeDoubles followed immediately by a call to flushBufferToChannel.
